meanings.definition: The amount that a head can hold or contain.
meanings.sent1: She carried headfuls of knowledge after studying all night.
meanings.sent2: The jar was filled with headfuls of colorful marbles.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fit headfuls of ideas into his tiny brain.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a treasure chest, overflowing with headfuls of memories.
meanings.sent5: The library shelves were stacked with headfuls of books.

meanings.definition: The plural form of headful, meaning a full or complete head.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient statues with headfuls of intricate details.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sold delicious pastries with headfuls of creamy filling.
meanings.sent3: The barber shop offered stylish haircuts for headfuls of customers.
meanings.sent4: The garden bloomed with flowers in headfuls of vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The toy store had shelves full of headfuls of playful toys.
